title: Multipart with no file causes InternalServerError
body:
## Problem statement

When I do:
```
curl -X POST -v -H "Content-Type: multipart/form-data; boundary=------------------------a31e2ddd4b2c0d92" http://localhost:8080/v1/file
*   Trying ::1...
* TCP_NODELAY set
* Connected to localhost (::1) port 8080 (#0)
> POST /v1/file HTTP/1.1
> Host: localhost:8080
> User-Agent: curl/7.54.0
> Accept: */*
> Content-Type: multipart/form-data; boundary=------------------------a31e2ddd4b2c0d92
>
< HTTP/1.1 500 Internal Server Error
< Content-Type: application/json
< Date: Thu, 01 Feb 2018 16:58:23 GMT
< Content-Length: 49
< Connection: close
<
* Closing connection 0
{"code":500,"message":"multipart: NextPart: EOF"}
```

I'm getting a 500 InternalServerError, but I think it ought to be returning a 4XX error instead as the error is on the client.

## Swagger specification

2.0

## Steps to reproduce

```json
"paths": {
    "/file": {
      "post": {
        "summary": "Deposit New File (binary).",
        "description": "Deposits a new File (binary) into SDR. Will return the SDR identifier for the File resource (aka the metadata object generated and persisted for management of the provided binary).",
        "operationId": "depositNewFile",
        "consumes": ["multipart/form-data"],
        "produces": ["application/json"],
        "parameters": [{
          "in": "formData",
          "name": "upFile",
          "type": "file",
          "description": "Binary to be added to an Object in TACO.",
          "required": true
        }],
     }
  }
}
```

## Environment
swagger version: 0.13.0
go version: 1.9 
OS:   OSX
